Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that former President Barack Obama "will be on new $1 dollar bill" when there are no plans to redesign the $1 bill and living people are not permitted to be on currency notes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no factual evidence or official announcement to support the claim that Obama will be on the $1 bill.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Obama will replace George Washington on the $1 bill, which is not supported by any official sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are no plans to redesign the $1 bill and living people are not allowed to be featured on currency notes.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing, which states that there are no plans to redesign the $1 bill due to it being seldom targeted for counterfeiting and the cost associated with upgrading bill readers for vendors.
